FuncDef: The display l2tp session-number command displays the number of L2TP sessions established based on a specified source IPv4 address.
CLIs: display l2tp session-number { lac | lns } [ source-ip <source-ip-address> [ vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> ] ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the L2TP session information of the LAC.
-

Displays the L2TP session information of the LNS.
-

Displays the number of L2TP sessions established based on a specified source IPv4 address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays the number of L2TP tunnel sessions in a specified VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: Source IP address Vpn-instance Session number
<HUAWEI> display l2tp session-number lac source-ip 1.1.1.1 vpn-instance 11
Source IP address Vpn-instance Session number
ExtraInfo: To check the number of L2TP sessions established based on a specified source IPv4 address, run the display l2tp session-number command. If source-ip-address is specified, the number of L2TP sessions established based on the specified source IPv4 address is displayed. If source-ip-address is not specified, the number of L2TP sessions established based on all source IPv4 addresses is displayed.
